column4: i would just look on the web but i can't access ubuntu wiki from my console browser for some reason... so if anyone knows how to dist upgrade from the command line that would be awesome
use nano to change all references in /etc/apt/sources.lst from breezy to dapper, then sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade
thanks.  when i change the references do i find them on the net, or literally just change every "breezy" to "dapper"?
it's possible that was a trasitory error. I do love apt-get.
you would not worry?  it was the final output, not an error message in the middle
when I am in doubt about my package state, I do sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get dist-upgrade. A few years has taught me to trust that line.
can't even be done, apt watches for that
groups <admin user> are all the normal groups for a user. You will need to add any other new user to the groups on that list
does that give them sudo access?
sudo adduser <new user> admin    adds your new user to the admin group. All members of the admin group have sudo privileges.
no, because they don't have the privileges unless you add them to the admin group.
right but wasn't adding them to that group the answer to give them sound?
no. adding them to the audio group gives them sound usage: sudo adduser <new user> audio
